decks.notes: The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control the board state and disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, along with versatile spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to maintain control of the game. The inclusion of cards like Dress Down and Prismatic Ending allows for flexibility in dealing with a variety of threats, while cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage provide card selection and recursion. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage.

Utilize creatures like Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom with combo pieces like Springheart Nantuko and Allosaurus Shepherd to quickly generate infinite mana with Gaea's Cradle, allowing for an explosive win condition with Chord of Calling or Green Sun's Zenith to find Thassa's Oracle and win the game on the spot. The deck also includes protection tools like Sylvan Safekeeper and Endurance to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to secure victory against opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Noble Hierarch to get out big creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Scythecat Cub. The deck also utilizes cards like Endurance and Elvish Reclaimer to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence. With access to powerful lands like Gaea's Cradle and Wasteland, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and efficient mana acceleration.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard, utilizing cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to bring them back into play. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game while also disrupting their strategy, making it difficult for them to recover. The use of cards like Brainstorm and Ponder also helps to filter through the deck and find the necessary combo pieces.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Mox Opal, Chrome Mox, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal. It then utilizes powerful cards such as Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate even more mana and cast a flurry of spells in a single turn. The key goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to cast a game-ending spell, such as Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony, to win the game in a single explosive turn. This deck relies on efficient mana generation and careful sequencing of spells to achieve victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands as a resource to control the game. It includes cards like Exploration and Crop Rotation to quickly ramp up land production, while also running utility lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful threats. Additionally, there are cards like Wasteland and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale to disrupt the opponent's mana base and creatures. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by managing lands effectively and utilizing powerful land synergies to gain control of the game.

The key concept of this Deadguy Ale aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk to pressure the opponent. The deck's strategy is further enhanced by cards like Swords to Plowshares for removal and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional value. By combining disruption, aggression, and a strong creature base, this deck aims to control the game and dominate the board.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counter spells, card draw, and disruptive creatures to disrupt your opponent's game plan. By using cards like Force of Will, Stifle, and Swords to Plowshares, you can keep your opponent on their toes while controlling the board with cards like Murktide Regent and Esper Sentinel. The inclusion of cards like Counterbalance and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student adds an additional layer of control, while the Phyrexian Dreadnought provides a powerful threat that can quickly close out the game.

Storm is the main focus of this deck, using spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to produce massive amounts of mana quickly. The goal is to cast multiple spells in a single turn to build up the storm count, eventually leading to a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Veil of Summer and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's plan. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a powerful and efficient combo sequence.

The deck is centered around assembling the Dark Depths combo, which involves creating a 20/20 Marit Lage token by removing ice counters from Dark Depths. The deck uses cards like Crop Rotation, Knight of the Reliquary, and Elvish Reclaimer to quickly find and assemble the combo while also controlling the game with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. The mana base includes various lands to support the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland. The deck aims to quickly set up the combo and win the game in a powerful and efficient manner.

This deck aims to use the combo of Goblin Welder, Painter's Servant, and Grindstone to quickly mill the opponent's entire library. It includes various ways to accelerate mana, protect the combo pieces, and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Goblin Engineer and Agatha's Soul Cauldron provide additional ways to find and recur the combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes some removal and disruption in the form of Pyroblast, Lightning Bolt, and Pithing Needle to handle opposing threats, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then utilizing Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a strong tempo advantage. Cards like Force of Will and Daze help protect the combo pieces, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Brazen Borrower to control the opponent's board. Ultimately, the key strategy is to efficiently reanimate game-winning threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back to the battlefield for a big advantage. Cards like Force of Will and Daze help protect your combo pieces while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help you dig for the cards you need. The deck focuses on a fast and explosive strategy, aiming to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells before they can respond effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, and then bring them back onto the battlefield with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo pieces. The combination of powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty with efficient reanimation spells creates a fast and potent strategy to overwhelm your opponent in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play with cards like Reanimate. It also includes disruption spells like Daze and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and control the game. The deck can also utilize cards like Entomb and Brainstorm to set up the graveyard and draw into combo pieces. The mana base includes dual lands and Wasteland to ensure consistent mana production while disrupting the opponent's resources. The goal is to quickly reanimate a game-winning threat and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize. Then, utilizing cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a big advantage. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and counter spells like Force of Will to protect the combo and control the game. It aims to win through the combo of reanimating powerful creatures while controlling the opponent's resources.
